intro: Tetracera stuhlmanniana var. occidentalis, commonly known as the western tetracera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with smooth, often glabrous bark. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually ovate to elliptical in shape. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
